items.title: Fortuna-trainer Buijs balanceert tussen balen en berusten na nipt verlies
items.summary: Het plan van Fortuna Sittard werkte 75 minuten lang prima, maar trainer Danny Buijs zag PSV uiteindelijk toch met de winst weglopen . De coach erkende de kwaliteit van de tegenstander, maar laakte ook zijn eigen ploeg.

items.title: NEC nadert Ajax na sensationele ontknoping tegen NAC Breda
items.summary: NEC is zaterdagavond twee punten ingelopen op nummer drie Ajax. De Nijmegenaren gaven tot twee keer toe een voorsprong weg tegen NAC Breda, maar sloegen in de absolute slotfase van het spektakelstuk alsnog toe.

items.title: Namli geeft visitekaartje af bij terugkeer in Zwolle: 'Hier voel ik me thuis'
items.summary: Met een halfjaar Ligue 1-ervaring in zijn rugzak, trok Younes Namli in januari huiswaarts naar Zwolle. Zaterdagavond keerde hij voor de derde keer terug in het MAC3Park Stadion van PEC, waar hij direct zijn visitekaartje af gaf met een heerlijke assist op matchwinner Shola Shoretire. De Deense spelmaker hoopt snel weer topfit te zijn.

items.title: Bosz opent boekje over spitsentactiek: 'Kleine mannetjes zijn daar goed in'
items.summary: Sinds met Luuk de Jong een fysiek sterke spits is vertrokken bij PSV, hanteert trainer Peter Bosz een andere tactiek. Hier vertelt hij over na de gewonnen wedstrijd tegen Fortuna Sittard.

items.title: Man United deliver huge blow to Man City title hopes with shock derby win
items.summary: Manchester City's title bid is as good as over after Manchester United won the midfield battle at Old Trafford.

items.title: VI Live: PaixÃ£o deelt mee in galavoorstelling Marseille
items.summary: Zaterdagmiddag staan er niet alleen vijf wedstrijden in de Eredivisie op het programma, maar ook in het buitenland staan ons veel mooie potjes te wachten. Te beginnen met de Manchester Derby, gevolgd door onder meer Real Madrid, Liverpool, Arsenal, Bayern MÃ¼nchen en Internazionale. Volg het (inter)nationale voetbal in deze VI Live.

items.title: Sources: PSG finalizing deal for Barcelona starlet
items.summary: Paris Saint-Germain are finalising the remaining details for the transfer of Dro FernÃ¡ndez, the latest prodigy from Barcelona's academy, sources confirmed to ESPN.

items.title: Arteta: Arsenal denied clear penalty in Forest draw
items.summary: Mikel Arteta has said Arsenal were denied a "very clear penalty" in Saturday's 0-0 draw at Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Wrexham captain McClean exits, joins Derry City
items.summary: Wrexham have announced that their club captain James McLean has moved to Derry City.

items.title: Slot 'understands' Liverpool fans' boos after draw
items.summary: Arne Slot said he "completely understands" the frustration of the Liverpool fans who booed the team following Saturday's 1-1 draw with Burnley in the Premier League.

items.title: Carrick proves Man Utd DNA isn't a myth - Hits and misses
Two-time winners Munster dumped out of Champions Cup; Leicester on cusp of exit
items.summary: Two-time European winners Munster were dumped out of the Champions Cup at the pool stage for the first time in a decade as they were stunned by Castres at Thomond Park 31-29.

items.title: Arsenal stumble in draw against resilient Forest
items.summary: Arsenal missed the chance to extend their lead at the top of the Premier League table to nine points, with a goalless draw against a determined Nottingham Forest.

items.title: Ruthless Man Utd beat Man City in dream start for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick gets off to the perfect start in his first match as interim manager for Manchester United with a two-goal derby win against Manchester City, leaving Pep Guardiola's side winless in their past four matches.

items.title: Wasteful Liverpool miss penalty in draw against Burnley
items.summary: Liverpool missed countless chances, including a Dominik Szoboszlai penalty, as a Michael Edwards equaliser grabbed Burnley an important point at Anfield.

items.title: Last-minute Wilson goal leaves fans booing Frank's Spurs
items.summary: A last-minute Callum Wilson goal gives West Ham an important three points and increases the pressure on Tottenham boss Thomas Frank.

items.title: Chelsea beat Brentford for Rosenior's first Premier League win
items.summary: Cole Palmer scored a penalty to secure the a for Chelsea against Brentford and give Liam Rosenior his first Premier League win as manager.

items.title: 'Sinner, Anisimova to claim Australian Open titles as Brits dealt tough draws'
items.summary: Sky Sports Tennis' Gigi Salmon looks ahead to the 2026 Australian Open, revealing her tips to claim the titles and looking at each Brit's draw in her latest column.

items.title: Arteta rails at Arsenal being denied â€˜clear penaltyâ€™ as Forest hold leaders
items.summary: Mikel Arteta was adamant his team should have been awarded a penalty for handball by Ola Aina 10 minutes from time that would have given Arsenal the opportunity to move nine points clear at the top of the Premier League. Instead Nottingham Forest hung on gamely for a doughty goalless draw in a performance redolent of the team last season who were pushing for European qualification. They may only be five points clear of the relegation zone, after West Hamâ€™s last-gasp win at Tottenham, but Sean Dyche was understandably proud of his teamâ€™s efforts that suggest Forest are moving in the right direction. Continue reading...

items.summary: Manager barracked by fans after late 2-1 defeat â€˜We need to get our head down and do the right thingâ€™ Thomas Frank believes he retains the faith of the Tottenham hierarchy and can turn around what he described as a â€œsupertankerâ€ of a club â€“ despite being barracked by the home crowd after a last-gasp 2-1 loss to West Ham. The fans in the South Stand chanted Frank should be â€œsacked in the morningâ€ after a defeat that kept them 14th in the Premier League. Spurs have won three of their past 15 matches in the competition. Continue reading...
